label: Untitled 3: Status response with conduit token
doc: A minimal JSON response indicating success and carrying a conduit (session/auth) token, likely used to authenticate subsequent requests.

children.label: status: 'ok'
children.doc: Signals the upstream operation completed successfully; downstream code may branch on this value.

children.label: conduit_token (JWT-like)
children.doc: Bearer credential used to authorize later API calls. Its structure resembles a JWT (header.payload.signature) and should be handled as a secret.

children.label: Token format
children.doc: Three dot-separated base64url segments suggest JWT-style encoding, enabling stateless verification by the server.

children.label: Security notes
children.doc: Do not log this token in plaintext; rotate/expire quickly; bind to device/session if possible.
